skill.name: matchms
skill.description: Mass spectrometry analysis. Process mzML/MGF/MSP, spectral similarity (cosine, modified cosine), metadata harmonization, compound ID, for metabolomics and MS data processing.
skill.summary: Mass spectrometry analysis. Process mzML/MGF/MSP, spectral similarity (cosine, modified cosine), met...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration patterns were found. Content is documentation and examples aligned with mass spectrometry workflows.

content.value_statement: You need reliable spectral matching and cleanup for MS data. This skill guides matchms workflows for importing, filtering, and scoring spectra.
actual_capabilities: Load spectra from MGF, mzML, MSP, JSON, and USI.
Apply default filters, normalization, and peak selection.
Compute cosine, modified cosine, and neutral loss similarities.
Build SpectrumProcessor pipelines for repeatable processing.
Export processed spectra to MGF and JSON.
limitations: Does not execute matchms, it provides guidance and examples.
Chemical fingerprinting requires rdkit and matchms[chemistry].
Requires user provided spectra files or USI references.

use_cases.title: Clean raw MS data
use_cases.description: Create a filtering pipeline to remove low quality spectra and normalize peaks.

use_cases.title: Match unknown spectra
use_cases.description: Score queries against a reference library using cosine or modified cosine.

use_cases.title: Design multi metric scoring
use_cases.description: Combine cosine, neutral loss, and fingerprint similarity with weights.

prompt_templates.title: Load and filter MGF
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a simple matchms pipeline to load an MGF file, apply default_filters, normalize intensities, and keep peaks above 0.01.

prompt_templates.title: Library matching
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a workflow to match query spectra to a reference MGF library using CosineGreedy with tolerance 0.1 and list top 5 matches.

prompt_templates.title: Add losses scoring
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a pipeline that adds neutral losses and scores with NeutralLossesCosine, including required metadata checks.

prompt_templates.title: Export cleaned data
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to clean spectra with quality filters and export the resulting spectra to MGF and JSON files.

output_examples.input: Match my unknown spectra to a library with cosine scoring and show top hits.
output: Load library and query spectra from MGF files
Apply default filters and normalize intensities
List top 5 matches per query with names and scores

best_practices: Use generator based loading for large files
Validate precursor_mz when using modified cosine or neutral loss
anti_patterns: Using fingerprint similarity without SMILES or InChI
Ignoring None returns from quality filters

faq.question: Is it compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides matchms guidance that works across those platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits on file size?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your environment, use generators for large datasets.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my Python pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, the workflows are designed for Python scripts and notebooks.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it only uses paths and data you provide in prompts.

faq.question: What if a filter returns None?
faq.answer: Check required metadata and apply prerequisite filters before scoring.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic MS tools?
faq.answer: It focuses on matchms APIs for reproducible spectral similarity workflows.
